channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AR
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AR

item.title: Report E-2024040066
item.description:
Report E-2024040066

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-05T15:11:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-28
  • City: BLYTHEVILLE
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 28, 2024, at 1223 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Blytheville, AR regarding the release of approximately (6) teaspoons of Chlorothalonil 98.5% PCT TC (Organochlorine pesticide, solid, toxic, UN2761, 6.1, II) from (1) 1012.3 lbs. bag. Upon arrival, contractors investigated and found no freestanding liquid or solids but confirmed that a material was released in small patches on the floor and is now completely dried. Contractors swept the entire trailer floor with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DF which was then staged onsite by the contractor in preparation for proper disposal pending analysis.

item.title: Report X-2024031280
item.description:
Report X-2024031280

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was found in unload and after inspection was determined that product was leaking inside box due to cracked inner container DescribePack: 1 inch crack in plastic bucket DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: placed in tote bin to keep leakage from getting outside container

item.title: Report X-2024031144
item.description:
Report X-2024031144

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-18
  • City: FORT SMITH
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: preload discovered package was leaking granules out side and package was placed in tote. spillage was cleaned up in house and placed in tote with package. DescribePack: bucket containing material is cracked on seam at bottom about 2-3 inches in length. when bucket was pulled out of box to inspect it is pouring granule material out of bottom and filling packing box bucket was shipped in. all contents and bucket in tote waiting disposition but entire contents will have to either be shipped back to shipper, picked up by consignee or disposed of with disposal vendor as bucket is leaking and can't repack in bucket or keep from leaking. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: placed box in tote to capture leaking material
